column1: floated full around the fifth stump, hint of movement away, Shaw lets it go

first runs in Test cricket and it comes courtesy a superb backfoot punch between cover and point. Length, he transferred weight back quickly and put that away. Good work by Keemo Paul, a sliding stop just as it was about to cross the point boundary.
squeezes this full and wide delivery to gully. No need to play at that, really.
slants in a length ball from wide of the crease, just around off, left alone

wide of the crease, full and seams back in sharply from outside off, 143.5kph Rahul inches forward, plays around his front pad and is pinned in front of middle. This is plumber than the Mario brothers, but Rahul instead goes for the review. This is missing off and leg, and crashing into middle. That was how plumb it was
bouncer outside off, Shaw lets it go
pitched up and outside off, left alone
shortish and outside off, Shaw reaches out and chops to point
back of a length on the hips, tucked off the hips to square leg

shot, Shaw! Short and wide outside off, 140ks, travels in a straight line. Shaw reaches out for the ball, gets on top of the bounce, and punches it crisply through point. The ball purrs away to the boundary - his first in Test cricket
back of a length and outside off again, Shaw gets on top of the bounce and cracks it straight to the covers now
another sharp nip-backer from Gabriel. Chops Pujara into half. Short of a length and swerves back in to zip past the inside edge. Gabriel sets the speedgun on fire too: 149kph
back of a length and outside off, about 15ks slower than the previous ball, Pujara has enough time to jab it back to the bowler
back of a length and angling into the pads, Pujara gets off the mark with a neat little clip to long leg
Gabriel bangs a bouncer outside off, Shaw has his eyes locked on it before ducking under it safely. And Gabriel's old problem is back: front-foot no-ball
full on middle and leg, he flicks it nearly all the way to the square leg boundary. Diving stop from long leg running to his left
wide of the crease, pitched up and holds its line outside off, 143ks, Pujara presses forward, meets the pitch, and drives through the line to the covers
shortish and outside off, 145ks, Pujara rides the bounce and drops the ball to point
slants a length ball into the pads and Prithvi has whipped this superbly into the gap between midwicket and square leg. Superb timing. VVS Laxman would've been proud of the wristwork
driven, but straight to point. This time the bat face turned slightly as he made contact with that full delivery
tickles to the fine leg boundary. Too easy. Two slips and a gully waiting to gobble up an edge, and what dos he do? Slant it down leg. Poor from Keemo.
slaps this length ball to cover point. Good stop there
high backlift again as it comes through to punch this length ball to point.
slashes to get a thick outside edge over the vacant third slip. Ravi Shastri's words ring loudly: 'flashes and flashes hard.' To the third man boundary like a tracer bullet!
full and angling in around the fourth stump from wide of the crease, left alone.
half-forward press from Pujara as he defends this full incoming delivery into the off side.
shows the full face of the bat to defend this incoming length delivery
excellent short ball on middle and leg, Pujara sways away from the line.
small little lunge forward as he defends to cover
steers this incoming length delivery to gully.
slips this short outside off, not much movement off the deck. Shaw leaves.
punched to the deep point region as he jogs the single. Defensive move already? Probably not for someone who is strong square of the wicket. Like Sehwag, he'll keep playing the cut shot.
works this full delivery on the stumps to mid-on.
short of length delivery angling in from outside off, left alone.
shows the full face of the bat and blocks this incoming delivery.
defends this length delivery into the off side with an angled bat.
touch fuller outside off, Shaw hangs back looking to cut, but realises this wasn't quite there for the stroke and lets it go.
slips this into the pads, flicked to deep square
shortens his length and angles it into the stumps, defended back.
full outside off, yorker-length almost, squeezed into the gully.
flicked nicely into the fine leg region. Bowled this into the pads from wide of the crease.
punches this length ball to cover off the frontfoot
stands tall and defends this short of length delivery into the off side.
gets half forward and bunts this length ball back to the bowler.
stands tall and defends this short of length ball back down the pitch.
driven handsomely down the ground. Free flowing blade this time. Mind you, this was not a half-volley but Pujara was ready as he laced this through the line. No chance for mid-on.
didn't go full throttle with that cut shot, just a gentle push to the point fielder. Scoring opportunity missed.
this is delicious! Much fuller, but the result is the same. A screaming on-drive that has Shaw looking to move his bat away in the nick of time at the non-striker's end.
drifts in and spins away from off stump, Shaw is beaten by sharp turn as he looks to cut. Length not there.
much fuller again, Shaw defends this off the backfoot when he may have been better off playing forward.
much better, head right over the ball as he smothers this full delivery
touch short on off, whipped across the line to midwicket
nice drift and dip for Bishoo but Shaw is upto the task as he lunges forward and blocks
works this across the line to long-on to jog the single and keep strike. Excellent first over from Bishoo
full on off from wide of the crease, square driven to deep point.
too short and he's slapped that through cover point. This is the inconsistency I was referring to earlier.  Too much width as well and Pujara pounced on it when it arrived
opens his wrists up to play this behind square this time, down to deep point again.
teases him with a wide delivery, tempting him to play the cut but Shaw is happy to leave this time
bunts this full delivery into the point region as he jogs the single
straying into the pads and Pujara whips this in front of square - Steven Smith style - to the boundary rider at deep midwicket
short and sliding down leg, Pujara uses the depth of the crease to paddle this fine to beat short fine leg. He's racing through now after a slow, industrious start.
too full on off, dabs to cover and scampers a run
gets to the pitch of the ball and swings this up and over the bowler's head. Just short of the advertising skirting. Not afraid to go for it. Flat-batted, bottom-handed power
punches this delivery off a length to sweeper cover
drifts in a full delivery on middle, Pujara lunges forward and blocks.
flatter and fuller on middle and leg, blocked.
drilled to mid-off, the captain dives to his right to save four. It was overpitched. Prithvi timed this superbly.
full and swinging away a hint from outside off, shapes to drive but lets it go.
low on pace, lands this at length, punched to cover.
dabs this slower length ball wide of point for a quick single
lunges forward and defends this slightly full length delivery into the off side.
dabs this into the vacant backward point region with an opened bat face for a single. It's drinks and you have to say the mini-session has belonged to India despite losing Rahul in the first over.
sharp turn from outside off, left alone
touch short, punched across the line to mid-on. Looked like Pujara just stopped short of playing a full-blooded whip.
cut away but can't pierce the gap, straight to point. This wasn't all that short for him to play that
another cut to a length ball, straight to point.
shows the full face to ease this full delivery wide of mid-on
lunges forward and stabs this indrifter into the leg side

this is delightful from Shaw! Too full and angling in, Shaw brings his wrists into play to play this ondrive on the up past the diving mid-on fielder. That there was a cover fielder may have influenced him into playing the stroke.
gets half forward and defends back
screamer! Too full outside off, gets a good stride towards the ball and then brings out his high backlift and elbows coming through to caress this through extra cover. Magnificent
floated full outside off, cut away off the backfoot to deep point
flicks this behind square to deep backward square leg
driven on the up, lands on the bounce to short cover.
steps out and eases this back to the bowler
steps out and whips this waist-high full toss wide of mid-on. Too easy
squeezes the drive to deep backward point
drift and turn from off stump, driven through the line to point.
uppish, but a superb stop at backward point by Kraigg Brathwaite. Shaw got this high on the bat because of the bounce
works this against the turn to long-on as he jogs the single
driven straight to extra cover
stopped short of a full-blooded cut, eased it away nonetheless behind point for a couple
steps out to a flatter delivery and dabs this back to the bowler.
steps out and works this with the spin to short midwicket
steps out and works this down to long-on
driven with the spin to long-on, Shaw one boundary away from a half-century on debut.
lunges forward and defends this tossed up delivery
looked to biff this across the line but changed his stroke and ended up easing this through to sweeper cover
steers this behind point, not much feet movement this time.
uses the depth of the crease to open up the leg side and whip this one to the deep square leg boundary. Poor from Bishoo, can't leak runs like that in a Test.
pulled again but straight to midwicket. Kept a touch low.
lunges forward and blocks this tossed up delivery.
defends this length delivery from the crease.
picks the gap at deep point as he punches this into the gap and completes the second comfortably.
eased past the bowler, but mid-on comes around to cut that off
will get the run this time. Too full, he got right to the pitch and eased this to long-on. Youngest Indian to score a half-century on debut
steps out and whips this superbly. Bisects the gap between midwicket and mid-on. Hetmyer runs around the ropes from wide long-on, even puts in a dive but ends up pushing the ball over the skirting.
steps out and turns this gently into the leg side
punched, the gully fielder takes some pace off the ball. Runs towards square third man
stands tall and defends this short of length delivery
banged in short but this is angling in, Pujara manages to avoid the bounce.
beaten! Loose from Pujara, the pace also may have played a part. Pujara pokes at this length ball that holds its line on off.
overpitched, Pujara leans into this and caresses it wide of mid-off, good work there by Chase
no timing on this attempted cut, rolls wide of point and they get a single
turns this with the spin to midwicket, good lunge forward
drifts in and skids through, Shaw gets a thick edge past slip as he stretches forward to defend.
steps out and works this wide of midwicket
tripe! This is a half-tracker, Shaw waits and waits and then slaps it when it finally arrives. No chance for sweeper cover.
too much width and he's belted that through extra cover again, is he batting in a net or what? This is too easy
defended back towards the bowler.
drops his wrists and gets out of the way of this short ball. Second no-ball for Gabriel today
defends this full delivery to cover.
just a half press forward, bat comes down in small arc before he suddenly deadbats this length ball. May not hurt him much on Indian surfaces, could be dangerous in England or Australia.
full and just a touch outside off from wide of the crease, left alone
touch full and just around the fourth stump, left alone.
right on top of the bounce as he defends, this one is turned behind short leg.
goes for a slap over point, but the length not quite there. Beaten!
steps out and works this full toss from outside off to the midwicket region. Just a gentle push, but the timing was magnificent.
steps out again and whips this back to the bowler.
fired full on the pads, worked to midwicket
fired full on middle and leg, tucked behind square. Good stop by the short fine leg fielder running across to his left.
flatter and just outside off, Pujara chips down the pitch and blocks.
drifting into the pads, tucked away towards deep square, Pujara jogs for a second so you can imagine how slow the fielder must have been in getting to the ball.
angles in a full delivery on off from wide of the crease, driven to mid-off.
slashed over point, races to the square third man boundary. This was a skiddy short of length ball, used the width to put this away behind the ring on the off side.
audacious! Another short ball, a slower one at that, Shaw looks to play an upper cut but is beaten.
whips this length ball from outside off towards deep square leg
cuts back in from outside off, left alone.
drilled back past the bowler, mid-off is too wide and he can only escort it to the boundary. Brings up a half-century off just 67 balls.
misfield off a full toss, down to long-on as Shaw jogs a single
steps out and blocks this full and flat delivery on the stumps.
works this with the spin to midwicket
worked wide of midwicket, the two paces down the pitch to meet the ball gave him a headstart for the single
turns this towards the leg side
works this off his hip to the deep square leg region, they jog back for the second.
dabs this behind point as they run the single quite easily.
no room to play the cut, but he goes through with the cut and gets a thick edge just wide of second slip. Had there been a fielder, he would've gobbled that up.
defends this length ball into the gap at point for an easy single
goes right back into the crease as he blocks this incoming short of length delivery.
uses the pace to steer this short of length delivery to point
sliding into the pads and he flicks this nicely into the gap at deep midwicket. That's going to be lunch on day one.
tossed up at a length on of stump, blocked on the front foot
length ball pushed through flat at leg stump. Punched to midwicket on the rise. That didn't turn
tossed up outside off, gets down for the sweep and goes after it. Doesn't get it off the middle - it's inside half - but all he had to do was beat midwicket to his right. He did.
cleanly struck. Off the middle this time. Meets this at the pitch on middle stump and goes across the line and against the turn as he drills it to the wide long-on boundary
good length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
short of a length on middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
length ball on off stump, punched off the toe-end to extra cover
carved it out to deep point. This was short of a length and the feet barely moved as he slapped it off the middle
starts with a boundary himself, does the senior partner. Length ball just outside off, gets behind the line and opens the face at the last moment to get it past second slip
full on middle stump, gently tapped to mid-on off the front foot
'two,' says Pujara immediately after punching this. It was a full one outside off, there for the drive. But he chooses to bunt it in front of deep point expertly
shot. Full ball with some angle in at off stump. He uses that angle to clip this wide of mid-on. Good balance. Weight moving into the ball too.
beaten and so is the keeper. Short ball outside off. Looks to cut it but it climbs over the blade. Wasn't a difficult take by any means but Dowrich lets it through
full on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
short of a length on middle stump, dabbed into the leg side with a closed face
tossed up on middle stump, goes across the line again and manages to sweep this to deep square's left
into the nineties. That's a poor ball. Dropped short on leg stump and he gets back to pull this to the right of deep square, who had moved to his left after that last shot
short and wide outside off, chopped straight to backward point
length ball angled into the corridor. Left alone
short of a length just outside off, opens the face and runs it to deep point
short ball in at off stump. Not there for the cut but he has fast hands. Chops it to deep point's left
short ball at off stump, closes the face as he flicks this to midwicket
full toss down leg side. Looks to whip it away but can't get bat on it
full on middle stump, driven to mid-on
short ball wide outside off and one again he finds backward point with the cut
length ball pushed through flat outside off. Punched on the rise to sweeper point
length on off stump, pushed with the turn into the covers
yorks himself after stepping out. It's a full ball on leg stump. He can't get it past midwicket
length ball turning away from middle stump, blocked on the front foot
full on leg stump, defended with the full face
length ball just outside off, punched on the rise to mid-on. Big gap between bat and pad as he played that
length ball in at off stump, pushed down the pitch off the back foot
nice-looking shot, but he can't get it past extra cover. Length ball in at off stump and he gets behind the line as he punches this
punched in front of point off the front foot. It's a length ball with some shape away in the corridor and he stays leg side of it and beats the man who is at deep backward point
short ball in the corridor, carved to deep backward point
full on leg stump, defended towards mid-on

Pujara dives back into the striker's end and the dressing room is in splits. Shaw nudged this through square leg and there was no chance of a second with midwicket putting in the slide. Shaw sent Pujara back
short ball outside off, backs away and chops to backward point's left. The fielder slides and stops
short on off stump, punched down the pitch
good length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length on off stump, defended into the covers
length on off stump, defended off the back foot
full on middle stump, tapped to mid-on

hundred! Gets it with a typically hands-only shot through cover against a length ball. Punches the air as he comes back for the second. A hundred on debut at better than run-a-ball. Is this the bright start in a long, long career? He's the fourth-youngest to a Test century on debut
length and in at middle stump, defended solidly off the back foot
offcutter at a length outside off, gets forward and slices to deep point
past the outside edge. This is a length ball slanting into the corridor and he looks to defend inside the line
length ball on leg stump, clipped to deep square from the crease
deft and past the backward point fielder. This is too easy for Pujara, he's done this in Rajkot forever. Short ball outside off and he plays it very very late. Caresses it to the fielder's right
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
length on off stump, steps out and drives to the bowler
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
short of a length on middle stump, gets deep in the crease and tickles it through square leg
short ball outside off, cuts from under it and is beaten
short of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
length just outside off, blocked on the front foot
overpitched outside off, nice flowing drive off the front foot. Finds extra cover
length on off stump, defended off the front foot
length on off stump, defended to point off the outside half
length ball in at off stump. Defended off the inside half of the bat
short and very wide outside off, follows it with his hands and dabs it past backward point once again. That's a terrible delivery.
length on off stump, blocked off the inside half
length on off stump, defended with the turn
good shot. Steps out and meets the flighted ball at the pitch before flicking to deep square
short of a length on middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
length on leg stump, pushed into the leg side against the turn
under-edge to gully as he tries to run one down to third man. Short ball zips through the corridor
length ball outside off, blocked on the front foot
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
full on off stump, jabbed into the off side off the front foot
shot. Overpitched on middle stump, gets the front leg away to allow for the bat swing and drills it past the stumps at the other end
length ball wide outside off, left alone
tossed up at off stump, driven straight to extra cover
short of a length skidder outside off, late cut straight to backward point
floated up at off stump, driven firmly back at the bowler
length on leg stump, pushed through midwicket off the front foot
length on leg stump, steps out and flicks into the leg side
short of a length on off stump, punched down the pitch off the back foot
length ball at the pads. Shuffles and bat-pads it into the leg side as he looks to flick
short ball wide outside off, the ball keeps low as he looks to play the cut. Beats his under-edge
full on middle stump, flicked with the angle to mid-on
length ball angled into the pads. Flicked to fine leg
short of a length on off stump, opens the face and runs it to backward point
length ball wide outside off, tapped to extra cover on the up
length outside off, left alone
length on middle, punched to mid-on
length ball wide outside off, left alone
length ball pushed flat outside off, left alone
length on off stump, hurriedly tapped into the off side
length ball wide outside off, left alone
length on off stump, blocked solidly on the front foot
beaten. Short ball outside off, looks to slash from under it but that gets too big on him
length ball just outside off, allows it to slant in and chops close to the body to bisect gully and backward point
length on middle stump, punched on the up to mid-on
overpitched on leg stump, flicked uppishly to fine leg
short ball just outside off, runs it to backward point with an angled bat
yorker length on middle stump, jammed down the pitch
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
short ball outside off, waits on it, opens the face and chops it past point. That's 200 for the partnership
short of a length on off stump, punched to sweeper cover
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
length on off stump, punched with the turn, on the up to long-off
length on off, punched uppishly into the gap at extra cover.
gets big on him as he looks to play this short ball off his toes, hit on the glove and then rolls down
short ball outside off, took a while to arrive. Pujara looked to play the cut but let it go in the end
slants in a full delivery on middle, defended towards mid-on
slants this too far down leg, avoided without a hassle. Good grab down leg by Dowrich

pokes at a length ball half-heartedly and Pujara won't get a hundred in his home ground this time. Plays it far away from the body when he could've well left it alone. What was he looking to do, really? I'm not sure. So much risk for a deflection behind point? Only managed to feather an edge and Lewis has his first Test wicket.
stands tall and punches this short of length delivery to cover
right behind the line as he punches this incoming length delivery towards mid-on.
superb stop at fine leg. This was destined to the boundary until Lewis ran across and then put out a full-stretch swimming pool dive to save two runs off the tickle
works this off his hip to deep square. Excellent wrist work to pick this off a length on middle
gets half a stride outside the line and defends to get a thick inside edge onto the pad.
slips a full delivery own leg. Kohli is beaten for pace as he attempts a flick behind square.
slips in a short ball towards the body, Shaw manages to get onto his haunches
wrists this incoming delivery to midwicket
arches back and then steers this short of length ball to gully.
slapped disdainfully over extra cover, slightly risky because there's protection in the deep. Shaw didn't hit it too well this time so it got to that fielder on the bounce
floats this full on off from wide of the crease, defended back.
right behind the line of this length ball as he stabs it back down the pitch.
beaten by one that holds its line. Raw pace, pure pace. Shaw was looking to work across the line but beat the leading edge and bounced to the keeper. Opened him up.
right besides the line of this short of length delivery as he defends.
awkward bounce off a length on middle but Shaw adjusts well to nudge this past square leg
slips in a short ball on middle, Kohli right on top of the bounce as he keeps it out
inconsistent. Slips it too far down leg, keeper with a good dive to his left to stop that as Kohli misses the tickle
good leave to a length ball way outside off.
driven uppishly to extra cover

thick edge off a cut, beats short third man to the boundary. The slip fielder had less than a fraction to react. Although Shai Hope anticipated the cut and took a step to his right, it just flew away.
fires one in from wide of the crease, defended
gets a good stride forward and smothers this
cut away but can't beat point
drills this drive straight to the cover fielder
slants in a length ball on off stump, defended towards point.
steers this length ball towards the gully region.
off the mark with a delicious flick to deep midwicket. Half-volley, lucky to get away with that
punches this length delivery to point
ducks under this short ball that flies way over his head
late reverse but it still slides down leg, Dowrich dives and gets a hand on it to take some pace off.
eased with the spin to long-off, generously tossed up this time by Bishoo. Gave it more revs as well. Shaw did well to get right to the pitch
shorter and faster on length outside off, defended back
gets fully forward and defends. The drift ensures Kohli gets a thick inside edge as it rolls to the leg side
goes back and across as he defends this shortish delivery
driven with the spin to long-off as they jog the single
drops short, Shaw uses the depth of the crease to transfer weight back and whip this into the gap at deep midwicket
works this with the spin to long-on for an easy single
reaches out to flat-bat this to the cover boundary. Didn't get to the pitch of the ball but went through with the stroke. Could've so easily sliced it to point
drifts in a quicker delivery, defended from the crease.
did he get some bat on it? An inside edge? Past the keeper and it runs down towards fine leg. Sharp turn for Chase. Thin inside edge according to the replays. Can't classify that as a chance though
plays for the turn but is beaten by the skid as Shaw looks to steer this behind square on the off side
squeezes this full delivery to the bowler. Wanted to beat him to run a single to long-on.
onto the backfoot as he whips to midwicket. Chase misfields to concede a run. Bad bounce

tame end to a knock that promised much more. Tried to punch this through cover but the ball stopped on him and resulted in Shaw simply chipping this straight back to Bishoo. Because he gave it a lot of revs, the ball turned just a little extra. West Indies have two wickets in the session now with tea just two minutes away.
drifts into middle and spins away, Rahane lunges forward and blocks.
nice and full on the stumps, defended back.
pushed through quicker at length, hint of turn on it but Rahane manages to defend comfortably
gets a good stride forward and blocks. It's time for a cup of tea says Ian Gould and off they go. India added 99, West Indies dismissed Pujara and Prithvi Shaw.
delicious straight drive first ball after tea to a 121.7kph half-volley. Nice high elbow and flourish to make this a bullet drive
stands tall and steers this short of length delivery towards point.
excellent leave. Slants one in full, just around off stump, Kohli gets a good stride in and then decides to leave
stands tall and punches this length delivery past point for an easy single
right back and across as he defends this incoming length delivery
slips in a full toss, hit straight to cover. Gift not taken by Rahane
sharp turn from length on off, punched to sweeper cover
nearly yorked himself in allowing it to drift in a long way. Missed out on a full toss which he ended up squeezing back to the bowler
driven with the spin to sweeper cover, off the mark finally.
fizz and low bounce from length on off, Kohli toe-ends this punch to cover.
eased with the spin to long-off
defends this sharp-turning leggie from the crease.
too straight on middle and leg, Kohli tucks this to fine leg
works this off length on middle to deep square leg
shows the full face of the bat to defend this length ball on the stumps.
presses half forward and defends.
tails in late from outside off, Kohli gets a thick inside edge towards midwicket.
floated full on off stump, Kohli gets forward and defends.
tentative in his forward press, the ball slides on to take the inside edge and roll past short leg. Rahane playing for the turn when there wasn't any
stretches forward and smothers this tossed up delivery
drifts in and spins away from off stump, left alone
punches this into the gap past the diving cover fielder
jabs at the ball which dips and spins away to hit the top part of the bat, lucky it didn't lob to silly point
rocks back and cuts, can't pick the gap. Straight to point. Rahane looking edgy at the moment
Gabriel has made a mess of a regulation stop at mid-off. Full, driven firmly, and he just dived over the ball. Shouldn't have been a run there, or at max just one.
imperious flick but straight to midwicket this time
on middle and leg at length, worked to deep backward square leg
gentle little dab into the off side as they squeeze in a quick single
good leave to a fizzy length ball that hit a crack and deviated in slightly, but not close enough to cause much discomfort to the batsmen
angles this length ball behind point to keep strike
breaks away sharply from outside off, left alone
gets a good stride in and dabs this tossed up delivery.
squeezes this full delivery back to Bishoo
drifts in a length ball on middle and leg, tucked to deep square leg
rocks back and cuts to deep point, much more authority and balance from Rahane
lunges forward and blocks this tossed up delivery.
veers in a yorker-length delivery on the stumps, Rahane drives to get a thickish inside edge past mid-on
gets across the stumps and whips this length ball to deep square leg
right behind the line as he solidly defends this back of length delivery.
right into the slot to drive but Rahane isn't yet fully confident driving through covers, so just ends up deadbatting it.
once again a little uncomfortable and rushed for pace as he looks to get on top of the bounce. Rolls off a leading edge to the off side.
half-press forward as he defends this full delivery
spins away from the rough outside off, left alone
fired in closer to the stumps, Kohli smothers it nicely
much closer to the stumps, hint of turn away, Kohli defends
eased with the spin to long-off
attempts a paddle but ends up toe-ending it past square leg.
works this across the line wide of mid-on for an easy single
slants this length ball down leg, worked to fine leg
rushed for pace again as Gabriel slants in a length ball, Rahane does well to get on top of the bounce and defend.
looks for a single with a gentle dab into the off side, Kohli refuses.
works this nicely off his hip to deep fine leg
nice tuck off his hip to deep square leg for an easy single
back of length outside off, not much bounce. Left alone by Rahane
gift of a full toss, driven hard. This hits the silly point fielder as he tries to take evasive action
drills another drive, this time to extra cover
works this against the turn off a length to deep square leg
stops on Kohli a touch as he goes back and across, defended back
punched into the gap at extra cover, easy single.
punched into the gap into the off side.
much more control from Rahane as he gets on top of the bounce and defends this skiddy short of length delivery
through with the pull much before the ball arrived, hit on the back

shifts back to a length ball and whips to deep backward square leg
full and flighted on leg, clipped to square leg
fires up a googly outside off, Kuldeep gets forward and blocks
defended down the pitch
full, sliding into leg, clipped behind square leg
flighted on off, driven to mid-off
gets down and forces a sweep though he's tucked up for room, gets a top edge to deep backward square leg
straightens outside off, backs away to make room and cuts to deep point. Puts pressure on the fielder in the deep for the second run
eased down to long-on
shot. Comes forward and goes inside-out to a fuller one, drives past the right of extra cover, where Keemo Paul moves across and lets it go through
turned away into the leg side
stays back and nudges a length ball into the leg side
length, pushed across off, shuffles across and defends
blocks a length ball outside off from the crease
gets forward and defends a fuller ball
gets the front foot across and clips into the leg side
full on middle and leg, blocked
gets down for a big slog sweep, helped by the angle as it's slid into his middle stump. Through deep midwicket
pushes a fuller one back to the bowler
defends a length ball into the covers
flighted well outside off, left alone
length, spinning away, blocked
shuffles across to a length ball and defends back
comes forward and smothers the turn
full, pushed across off, eased away to long-off
gets down to sweep but has to fetch it from well outside off, gets hit on the forearm before it lobs up to hit the helmet grille
shuffles across but this one's slid in sharply and turns in even more sharply to pin him in front. Moved across a fair bit and so it was well in line with the stumps. Hitting middle, in fact
slider, flicked away to square leg
pitched up outside off, blocked
full, curving into off, front-foot defence
extra bounce and some turn, Jadeja adjusts well by going back and cutting through third man. Fifty for Jadeja, celebrates how else but by wielding the bat like a sword. This is his home
pushes a fuller one down to long-on
turns it away to midwicket
gets down for an ambitious slog but it's nowhere close to being full enough to make contact
advances down the ground and meets the pitch before swinging over long-on. Flattish but safely over the head of the fielder in the deep
defends off the outside of the bat into the covers and they scamper across for a quick one
advances but this one's a bit too full and wide, and he can't get underneath it as a result. Drilled away to long-on
nudged with the turn behind square leg
tries to cut but the ball spins in and takes away the room required
Umesh, with his favoured slog. Finally makes some connection. Full, outside off, and in his swinging arc. What more has a tailender ever needed?
length ball that refuses to turn and goes past the edge of an unsuspecting Umesh
pushes a fuller one back to the bowler
pitched up outside off, flicked with the turn down to long-on
spins away from outside off, cuts and finds point
oh, that's some tremendous wristwork. Full and pretty wide outside off, gets the foot across but it's the handwork that does everything here. Whipped through deep midwicket
tossed up on middle, driven to cover
length, straightening down middle and leg, knocks it to midwicket
rocks back and drags a length ball to midwicket
comes forward and drops this to cover for a quick one
Jadeja having some more fun. Keeps the crowd roaring in this stifling heat. Pitched right up, allowing him to get underneath that, enough room to free up the arms, and shovels over long-on
turns in pretty sharply from the rough outside off and pings him on the glove
gets down to slog and the ball rolls along to deep midwicket off the inside of the bat
down the ground, right to the pitch, and a flat shovel straight down the ground
gets some room and cuts hard but finds the sweeper at the cover boundary

Umesh showing Jadeja that he can match him stroke for stroke. This is once again feeding the strengths of a No. 10 who's going to swing at everything. Full, wide, in the arc, and miles over deep midwicket
short, straightening, cut to sweeper cover
flicked away with the angle and turn to square leg
length ball, slightly spins away, defended to point off the front foot
full and flat on middle and leg, turned away to midwicket
tries to cut with almost zero room, the ball whizzes past the outside edge and off-stump
waits and waits before opening the face very late for a neat dab down to third man
fired wide outside off, lets it go
fired well outside the reach of Umesh who moves across and lets it go
wide again but now he swings wildly at it and gets beaten
short, wide, cut to the sweeper at cover
short, way too erratic, drops mid-pitch and skips down leg

dropped. Jadeja gets a reprieve. Tries to flick this with the turn to midwicket but it's not as full and he gets an edge. Hetmyer runs back and goes at it with one hand and lets it spill out. Tough one but catchable
swings wildly at a wide length ball and shovels it flat and straight to long-off. End of a very entertaining stand
pitched up outside off, driven down to long-on
backs away and cuts to sweeper cover. Refuses the single
advances down the ground and shovels it straight back. Bishoo gets a hand to it
gets down to slog and drags it to midwicket
these are generously pitched up and well inside his swinging arc. Feeding Jadeja's strengths with another help yourself, as he comes down the track and lofts it straight over
drills a fuller one down to long-on
flat, short, angled in, pulls it away to short fine
leg side fuller ball, gets down to launch it over the leg side and cops it on the pad instead
full, slid into leg, defended
length, angled in and skips down leg
poor lines again, down the leg side, and Jadeja just turns around and helps it along to fine leg
full on middle, driven down to long-on
full outside off, gets down for a slog sweep to deep midwicket
lets it spin in from outside off and guides it to point with the full face
stays back and punches a length ball to cover
six more.. on to 97 and just three short of his maiden ton. Another charge down the ground and sends it soaring straight down the ground. Just how many has he collected there today?
cuts as he finds room. Sweeper cover moves to his right. Takes a single and moves to 98 and keeps the strike
full and accurate on middle, defended
full, angled into leg, pushed back
defends a length ball into the covers. Three dots, but what's the rush?
gets a fuller one on the pads, flicks but finds midwicket
full and straight on middle, defended back
ah, can't put it away. Doesn't find the gap at point as he flays a cut. Maiden over. Jadeja two short
oh nearly! Shami reaches out as this ball turns away, but it also bounces, and he gets an edge just past second slip
gets some room and unfurls the cut. Takes the single and moves on to 99
presses forward and defends a fuller one into the leg side
shuffles across and tucks a length ball to midwicket
nicely floated up on middle and leg, Shami defends off the outside of the bat into the off side
shuffles across to a length ball that turns away and gets beaten
short, banged in and slid down the leg side. Jadeja swivels and pulls but the angle's too sharp
a more accurate length ball on off, blocked back. Shami casually strays out of the crease but makes it back as the bowler collects the throw
flat and full, defended to cover

there it is.. maiden Test hundred for Jadeja. This has been a long time coming. He has three triple tons in first-class. Just toe-ends a drive down the ground to mid-off and takes flight. Keeps running and jumps in the air, fists pumping and a loud roar to match the one he gets from the hometown crowd. Accompanied by the sword-wielding, of course
pushes a fuller one to sweeper cover
skiddy length ball back in to hit him high on the thigh as he tries to work it to the leg side
in the off-stump channel, touch fuller, moves away off the seam as well. Left alone
flicks this full delivery on middle and off towards midwicket
right behind the line of this full delivery as he defends back to the bowler.
veering back in towards the stumps from wide of the crease, worked to midwicket
easy pickings to get off the mark. Too full on the pads, flicked to fine leg
wayward delivery first up. Slips this length delivery down leg, through to Pant
turns this incoming delivery towards fine leg. May have got a faint tickle, yes given runs.
back of length delivery angling away, defended with soft hands towards point
free-flowing drive but he wasn't leaning into it as well as he would've liked. Straight to mid-off
shows the full face of the bat to defend this back down the pitch. Solid from Powell
squared up by the length as he goes back to defend, squirts this towards gully.
full and there's an invitation to drive, Brathwaite toe-ends it to cover. Once again, the body not coming through with the stroke. Was looking to play from the crease.

this is a cracker of a delivery from Shami! The off-pole takes a walk and it has to do with a number of deliveries he kept taking away. Brathwaite plays for one that moves away but this one hits the seam and jags back in to sneak through the gap, hit the pad and crash into the stumps. The third umpire has a look at a number of replays and gives it in favour of the bowler.
excellent leave first up. Looks to play but leaves a short of length ball that jags back in from outside off.
good leave again. Length ball that skids through from outside off, excellent carry to Pant.
full and swinging away from outside off, left alone.
lifter off a length on middle, turned to the leg side.
misfield by Prithvi Shaw at midwicket gives away a run off a flick
angles back in from outside off, hits him high on the thigh pad as he tries to work this behind square
wayward length ball down leg, regulation take for Pant
right behind the line of this short of length delivery as he defends back
gorgeous straight drive! Pitched up and deserved to be put away, he just lent direction and a lovely little followthrough of the bat to find the boundary
hops back and punches this unto the off side.

going too far across and he's gone. Shami has struck from around the wicket and is on fire. Middle and leg visible at the point of impact. On a Rajkot track where it's hard to get it bounce, those can never be overturned. Powell, apart from playing a poor shot, has also burnt a review KL Rahul style
ripper of a short ball angling in from around the stumps, Hetmyer drops his gloves and sways out of the way
squirts this full delivery back to the bowler. Not much feet movement
back of length outside off, Hetmyer shoulders arms. Good carry through to Pant
right behind the line of this incoming delivery as he defends.
lovely on drive, but can only hit it down towards mid-on.
plays inside the line of this full delivery as he watches it zip through to the keeper
drifting into the pads, worked nicely to fine leg
that's more like it from Umesh. A slight slant across at an angle where the batsman is forced to consider playing at it, this time it flies through to the keeper.
thick edge and it flies to the third man boundary through the vacant gully region. Failed drive, lucky to get away.
back of length delivery angling away, he plays inside the line and watches this thud into the keeper's gloves.
driven straight back to the bowler, who stops it on his followthrough
floated full around off, defended back
this one wobbles back in alarmingly after it passes the batsman, Pant can't grab it cleanly. Thuds into his chest.
wants to drive, then leave and in the end sees the ball roll off the toe-end to slips as he tries to leave
hops across to defend this short of length delivery but is surprised by the low bounce, somehow manages to keep this delivery out
shows the full face of the bat to ease this down to mid-on

this is so very wonderful from Hope, one that elicits a lot of hope for West Indies. This is absolutely full and veering in, Shai Hope brings his bat down straight to drill this back like a rocket to beat mid-on.
works this gently past midwicket for an easy single
sharp turn, he rocks back to cut but ends up getting a thick inside edge onto the pad. Nice dip for Ashwin
gets across the stumps and eases this past short third man
drifts in and skids through to hit him on high on the thigh pad as he tries to go back into the crease and block
too full on the pads, tucked towards square leg
lunges forward and smothers this tossed up delivery.
touch fuller around off stump, defended from the crease
wants to leave, ends up dragging his bat out late, rolls off the toe-end to gully
beauty! Squares Hetmyer up as he tries to defend. Not far from the outside edge
low bounce again, Hetmyer hops back to defend and sees this roll back off the toe end to the bowler.
yorker-length on middle, squeezed past the bowler for a quick single
hops back and punches this length ball to mid-off
slides a length ball in towards middle and leg, tucked to deep square leg

beauty. This one drifts in and skids through to clip top of off as Hope plays inside the line to be beaten. This is terrific from Ashwin. Hope played for turn when there was none here. The ball hit the stumps and deflected towards Pant's face. Initially, the reaction from everyone suggested this missed the stumps.
lunges forward and blocks.
too full and he drills this to beat mid-off, crrrrrrrrrrunch
lunges forward but is beaten by one that goes straight on, good grab by Pant

this is insane stuff, charging down the wicket to hoick a frontline spinner with you side three down and facing a deficit of 600 plus. Gets away with it this time, but didn't get to the pitch. Just about managed to beat mid-on.
full around off from around the stumps, defended.
plays down the wrong line, zips past the outside edge
length ball outside off, left alone
right on top of the bounce as he defends this short of length delivery to extra cover
solidly defends this incoming length delivery to the off side
wants to play but ends up leaving, good decision
eased back past Ashwin towards long-on. I'm actually thinking why there's a man that deep. Why not let Ambris charge down the pitch again?
slider from around the stumps, defended as he gets a good stride in.
tossed up on middle, he lunges forward and blocks again.
skips down the pitch, doesn't get to the pitch but lofts through the line to clear mid-on. Living dangerously

whips this across the line to mid-on, there's a case of both batsman at one end. Ambris having run all the way to the striker's end has to now run all the way back. But he doesn't, leaving Hetmyer stranded. What does Jadeja do? Instead of throwing the ball to Ashwin, he runs in and as it to taunt the batsman, gives the impression he'll eventually break the stumps, but wait, with him around three of four yards away from the stumps just throws the ball at the stumps. It hit this time, so it's all good, but I'm just imagining the comical scenes if he would've missed. I think that's exactly what Kohli's telling him too. Absolute joke the running between the wickets. West Indies are committing hara-kiri, folding faster than it would take for them to get back to the heart of Rajkot from Khanderi, where the stadium is located.
defends this full and flat delivery on the stumps.
tailed back in from outside off, defended.
length on middle and leg, whipped to deep square leg
late reverse back in from length, defended off a thick inside edge
veers this down leg, Ambris looks to tickle it fine but misses.
stifled appeal for lbw but this would've gone over. Hit high on the thigh pad.
again on the thigh, the bounce and pace of Umesh resulting in some discomfort
defends this indrifter from the crease
sharp turn from outside off, cuts him into half and beats Pant too. He may have been blinded, but no excuses.
this one skids through after drifting away, takes the thick edge. Rahane instinctively puts his right hand out on the dive, but can't get there.
squeezed towards backward point
drift and turn, rolls off a thick inside edge to short leg
goes right back into the crease and defends back.
length ball outside off, shuffles across and blocks
short of a length, angling in towards off, blocked to midwicket
full, angled in, flicked away behind square leg
fuller of a length, angled towards off, kept out into the on side
short of a length, leaves him slightly outside off, tries to reach out and misses
flicks a legside-headed fuller ball to deep fine leg
advances down the ground and clips it wide of long-on
harmless length ball outside off, Chase gets down and muscularly slogs it over midwicket. Just lands inside the ropes
lets this length ball spin in and flicks it away to deep midwicket
shuffles across towards off and blocks
gets the front foot across and turns it away behind square leg
pushes a fuller one out to mid-off

and Jadeja's back at it. Ambris attempts an extravagant shot through the off side and edges to the cordon for his troubles. Nicely looped up outside off, full but just enough time to start turning as Ambris reaches out swinging extravagantly and sends a catch flying to first slip
sliding fuller ball on leg, pushed back
pitched up outside off, driven to cover
short of a length, angled into leg and straightening, backs away and punches through the covers
drives a fuller one to cover
lets a straighter one that doesn't turn go outside off
pushes a fuller one out through backward of point
shifts back and flicks a length ball to midwicket
comes forward and blocks off the inside of the bat as it spins in
length ball, minimal turn, worked to midwicket
gets across and blocks into the off side with bat close to pad
back of a length, makes a little room and punches through the covers
stays back and blocks a length ball into the off side
back of a length, blocked into cover
pitched up on off, driven to mid-on
turns it away with the spin into the on side
pitched up outside off, crunches a drive that strikes the boot of the jumping silly point fielder
short, wide, makes room and flays a cut through point. Boundary against the run of play
length, spinning into off, blocked
shovelled straight over the bowler's head. Pitched right up, gets underneath it easily and gives it a good whack
length, spins in, tucked to midwicket
full, spinning in towards off, blocked
clipped off the pads, midwicket cuts it off with a dive
full around off, defended off the outside of the bat to the off side
full, sliding into middle, blocked
looped up on middle and leg, driven out to extra cover
presses forward and pushes this to silly point, hits the boot of Shaw and deflects away
gets some width and cuts but finds point
tossed up and drifting into leg, squeezed out back to the bowler
full on off, front-foot defence into the off side
floats up a fuller one that's driven to cover
leg-side fuller ball, comes forward and blocks
pitched up on middle, turned away to square leg
full and flighted on middle, pushed back
drives a fuller one and finds mid-off
looped into middle, comes forward to defend and the ball rolls towards short third man off the outside of the bat
drives a fuller one into the covers
legside fuller ball, clipped behind square leg
shortish, straightens outside off, cut to point
driven to cover
looped up towards off, pushed out to point on the front foot
wrong'un on leg stump, defended with soft hands.
lofted but no timing, ends up dragging it to the long-on region.
breaks back in from a length, he goes back into the crease and turns this into the leg side
driven to mid-off, got too close to the delivery this time.
quick single to mid-off, Jadeja was alert but wasn't going to prevent it
enough time to use the depth of the crease and tap this wrong'un into the off side for a single.
sliding down leg, he shapes to sweep but is beaten for pace. Pant can't get across in time to stop that, four byes.
fired full on the stumps, blocked.
flat and full on the stumps, kept out
slider on the stumps, defends with the bat close to the pad
driven with the spin to extra cover
rocks back and cuts to deep point for an easy single
tries to flick a fuller one and gets hit on the pad

he's thoroughly been outfoxed here. Kuldeep invitingly tosses this one up, Dowrich falls for the bait and comes forward. Jams the bat down but it lands outside off and turns back in super sharply to sneak underneath the bat and tip the bails off
pitched up on middle and off, gets forward and blocks

Keemo is unable to deal with the spin. The ball goes up in the air as he tries to flick and falls short of forward short leg. But, no inside edge. Was there a glove perhaps? Prithvi Shaw runs back and dives but the ball lands in front
attempts a massive slog. He hasn't got hold of it. This is a definite mishit. Rahul at mid-on runs back and the ball drops short. He manages to pull it back, though, and prevent the boundary
comes down for another big heave and the ball rolls off the inside edge instead into the leg side
comes forward to defend a fuller one and inside-edges it to the pad
full, fired down the leg side
fuller ball that curves in sharply, Keemo Paul presses forward and the bat turns in his hands as he knocks it to midwicket
again, sharp inward movement. Good swing here, Keemo just about barely manages to get bat on ball. Miss one of these and you're lbw or bowled
muted appeal for leg before as he pings the pad with some reverse swing. He's getting these to come back in significantly, so that's going to hurt his chances of getting the lbw in his favour
this one just comes on with the angle, flicked off the pads to square leg, easily beats the fielder giving it chase
advances down the ground, dares to take on the left-arm wristpinner even though he hasn't been picking him well. But this one's pretty full, allowing him to get on top and shovel it over long-on
pitched right up again, gets down and crunches a sweep along the ground through square leg
back of a length, comes on with the arm, shifts back and blocks
comes forward and swipes blindly against the angle. Goes down on one knee as he misses and Pant takes the bails off, but the backfoot never left the crease
full, spins in from middle and off, rolls away off the inside edge
fuller ball that reverses away, gets a bottom edge to the keeper
this time he gets it to swing into the right-hander, blocked to mid-on
full toss, moves into him in the air, flicked off the pads to deep square leg
falls over as he tries to flick a fuller one that curves in sharply and raps the pad. Heading down leg with that sort of movement
extremely full outside off, squeezed out back down the pitch
and he sees it off by gently turning a fuller one with the angle to midwicket
length ball turning into off stump. Backs away and punches to extra cover
well placed. This is tossed up on middle stump and he's in full control as he gets low and sweeps this in front of square
short ball turning in at off stump, backs away again and punches. This time he gets it wide of extra cover
inside edge to leg slip. Too early on the cut this time. Short ball on off stump and the horizontal bat shot doesn't work for him
length on off stump, beaten on the inside edge as he gets forward to defend. Cops it on the body
swept firmly again and even deep backward square can't get to it. A tad full on middle stump and Keemo swings it away
full outswinger in the corridor. Marginal shape away. Gets forward and stabs it wide of mid-off
length ball swinging in at middle stump. Stays deep in the crease and defends into the leg side
full inswinger on off stump, hurriedly pushed to mid-off
full toss as he looks to swing a yorker in at middle stump. There is shape for sure. Chase punches to short mid-on
length ball shaping in at off stump. Solidly defended off the back foot
lands the yorker in the corridor, it's shaping away. Jammed into the covers
off the glove and too far to the left of diving Shaw at short leg. Once again he's exposing the stumps to try and punch through point. It's too full for that shot and this pings off the glove
length on middle stump, swept sweetly out to deep backward square
short of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
length on middle stump, pushed to midwicket off the front foot
dropped short at middle stump, gets deep in the crease and pulls to deep midwicket
length on off stump, blocked into the covers off the front foot

Keemo survives a run-out chance. Poor judgement on that run. The length ball is tapped to extra cover's left. It's bouncing up nicely for Kuldeep who picks up one-handed and shies at the striker's stumps. He can't hit it
beaten. Shami with the reverse-swing ball that leaves the batsman. It's full and it draws Keemo into the drive
beaten again by the outswinger. This one is fuller than the last one and he jams the bat into the turf as this skids by
thick outside edge past gully and into the third man boundary. He keeps on chasing outside off. Walks down the pitch at the full ball this time and still can't control the drive as it swings away
fired down leg side and Pant can't stop it. Shami looks to bring it back in after the set-up, but he can get neither line nor length - it was a full toss - right
length ball curving in at middle stump, blocked into the covers
tossed up at off stump, driven against the turn to mid-off
drilled wide of extra cover. Tossed up at off stump, gets the front leg down with half a stride and pummels it

in the air but safely wide of midwicket. Who seemed to have been straighter all this while. More square this time. This is tossed up on middle and he swings an ugly swing with the feet well outside leg stump
length on off stump, tapped into the off side
short of a length on leg stump, dabbed to short fine off the back foot
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length ball swung in at leg stump, jabbed into the midwicket region
appeal for lbw but Keemo had walked down before being rapped on the pad. Another inswinger but it's short of a length and possibly climbing over/going down
outside edge dribbles past gully. This is a good ball from Shami. Takes it away from middle stump on a length. Keemo goes deep to try and defend it and is not in control once again
length ball down leg side, can't get bat on the flick
full inswinger at middle stump, defended with the full face
another full incoming ball. On off stump. Blocked into the off side
full on off stump, driven to mid-off against the turn
length on off stump, gets forward and stabs at it with hard hands
length ball on leg stump, swatted away to the square leg boundary with the sweep
length on off stump, pushed into the leg side off the inside half
full outside off, dead-batted on the front foot
good-looking shot to wide long-on. Length ball on middle stump, stretches out and lofts cleanly in the direction of the turn. It goes high and lands just short of the boundary
full on off stump, defended into the off side from deep in the crease
short of a length just outside off, defended off the back foot
length ball in at off stump, defended from deep in the crease
beaten on the outside edge. Length ball in the corridor, holds its line after angling in to zip past his defence
full inswinger at off stump, looks to drive on the up, gets it to mid-on off the inside half
<b>inside edge<b> onto pad saves him as he gets on the back foot and offers an angled bat at a big inswinger. Not quite picking the line at the moment with all this movement
full on off stump, pushed back down the pitch off the inside half
length on middle stump, gets back in the crease and tucks it behind square on the leg side
googly, short of a length on middle and turning away. Backing away and still on the move as he pushes to extra cover
shot. He's good at the sweep, never a subdued shot. Length ball on middle, quickly under it and he clears the midwicket boundary, flat
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
short of a length outside off, chopped to point
length ball in at middle stump, gets deep in the crease and defends
full on the pads, clipped to deep square off the front foot
outside edge as he fishes for the incoming ball yet again. The reverse takes it away. And it's past gully to his left

gets him with the bouncer! Keemo has not been comfortable against Umesh, who has been changing it up in what has been an incisive 10-ball spell. This bouncer climbs at the chest and Keemo slices the pull off the high part of the bat. It lobs up for midwicket who dives forward and holds on
short of a length in the corridor, defended off the inside half on the back foot
bouncer on a leg stump line. Ducks to evade this
floated up wide outside off, nicely in the slot for the drive and Chase holds a beautiful shape and a high elbow as he drives through the over
length on middle stump, driven to long-on
length on off stump, pushed with the turn to mid-off on the up
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot

fifty with a glorious straight drive. It's been a while since this man's got a big score, this will make him happy. It's a full ball on off stump again and he has no issues getting to the pitch. After that, he drills it sweetly between non-striker and stumps
length on off stump, mistimed drive into the off side
short of a length and slanted across off stump. Looks to defend on the back foot but this is past the outside edge
length ball keeps low outside off as it skids past the outside edge on the defence
length on off stump, shape away from middle stump. Defended off the back foot
length ball wide outside off, left alone
length ball shaping away outside off, left alone
length on off stump, defended to backward point off the back foot
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
short of a length just outside off, defended to point off the back foot
quicker one at a length on off stump, defended to extra cover off the leading edge

dropped by Pant. This length ball jumps up at Chase in the corridor. He plays on the back foot with an open face and Pant jumps late as this gets big on him. Hard hands as a result and he can't hold on on the second attempt to his right, with a dive
length on leg stump, flicked to deep midiwicket
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
full on the pads, clipped into the leg side
length ball shaping in at middle stump, defended down the pitch off the front foot
length ball outside off, left alone
short of a length outside off, left alone
short of a length on middle stump, gets on top of the bounce and nudges it through square leg
full and in at off stump, looks to defend on the front foot and gets it off the inside edge
length ball on off stump, blocked on the front foot

what a ball! Oh that is vicious from Ashwin. A dipping, drifting, flighted ball outside off stump lulls Chase into a loose shot. Looks to drive on the up, against the turn with a massive gap between bat and pad. This is a proper set up, because Chase has barely been made to stretch outside off against spin. Gets an inside edge and it's into the stumps
length ball pushed through quickly outside off. Beaten on the forward defence
beaten again. Full outside off, late on the forward press

takes it away from middle and hits off stump. Runs his fingers through this like a legcutter and it's on a length at middle stump. Lewis goes on the back foot to defend for the offbreak, but this has ripped away quickly to clean him up. He doesn't know what's happened, stares blankly at the non-striker

why did he do that?! beaten on the inside edge as he looks to tonk Ashwin over long-on. It's lobbed up generously outside off and he doesn't get anywhere close to this. There's plenty of bounce too as it beats him and Pant can't stop to his left
short of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
nicely hit. Pushed full and flat outside off, gets the front leg out and swings to get this to the midwicket boundary

dropped by Pant again. This is a big deviationbut Pant's static. The arms haven't moved at all. Length ball outside off. He defends inside the line and gets a big edge. Deflected past slip off Pant's gloves
length on middle stump, flicked into the leg side off the front foot
length ball in at off stump, blocked on the front foot
length ball pushed through flat at off stump, blocked on the front foot
length on leg stump, pushed into the leg side off the front foot
length on leg stump, tapped into the leg side
tossed up wide outside off, gets to the pitch and sweeps again to find the midwicket boundary
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length ball down leg side, looks to flick. Deflected fine off the pads
full on off stump, flicked to midwicket
top edge wide of backward square leg. Length ball on middle stump, sweeps at it as it rises up but he's safe
short of a length outside off, defended off the back foot
length on off stump, swipes across the line and gets this to long-on's right. Yadav puts in a luge to stop it
length on middle stump, blocked on the front foot
lands between mid-off and cover. Length ball outside off, looks to carve it over the off side but can't get it away because he's not to the pitch of the ball
length on off, blocked on the front foot
carrom ball at a length on middle, raps him on the thigh guard as he gets back
length on the stumps, blocked down the pitch
length ball turning in from off, beats the inside edge and hits him on the body
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot

sent upstairs for the stumping. It looks out. A good stumping. Nervous gather from Pant, but his hands are quick after he has the ball. Gabriel has lifted his back leg after Ashwin spins one away from a full length on off stump.
full ball on middle stump, squeezed through square leg off the inside half of the bat. That was uppish, he was poking with hard hands
length ball shaping away from off stump, left alone
full outswinger outside off, gets forward and gently taps to mid-off
thick outside edge. Length ball on off, jagging away off the surface as he defends with hard hands. Trickles out to point's right
length ball just outside off, left alone
big lbw appeal as Brathwaite falls into the off side trying to play the flick. This hasn't held its shape or swung. It's going well down leg
length ball at a sixth stump line. Left alone
length ball in at off stump, pushed into the leg side off the inside half
shot. Length ball outside off, steps out and doesn't get to the pitch, but he goes through with the shot ad lifts it over mid-off
length outside off, steps out and pokes it into the off side
length on off stump, defended off the front foot
beautiful. A gorgeous step-down and swing from Powell to lift this over long-on. It's a length ball on middle, this time he gets to the pitch and clubs it
full on middle stump, blocked on the front foot
length ball just outside off, tapped into the covers on the up
length ball just outside off, blocked on the front foot
length on off stump, gets behind the line and flicks to mid-on
length on off stump, allows it to come and flicks to the square leg boundary
falls short of midwicket. Length ball on middle stump, flicks with static feet
length ball at off stump, defended from deep in the crease
full on off stump, driven firmly to mid-off's left
length ball just outside off, defended off the back foot
length ball outside off, thinks of pushing at this but chooses to leave at the last moment
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
short of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
length on off stump, defended to midwicket off the back foot
falls short of second slip. Shami gets this to straighten at an off stump line after angling it in. Powell jabs with hard hands but this won't carry to Rahul
length on off stump, defended with the angle into the leg side
length ball in at off stump, blocked on the front foot
length ball in at off stump, blocked on the front foot
full ball in at off stump. Keeps a gap between bat and pad as he drives to mid-on off the toe-end
nice. Full ball wide outside off, plants a big stride out to reach this and gets his hands through the line to find the cover boundary
length on off stump, turned into the leg side off the back foot
length ball dipping outside off. Drifts away at the last moment too. Brathwaite watches closely and allows it to go
length on off stump, poked into the leg side off the back foot
close to the back pad, but he's outside the line of off stump, so he knows where his stumps are as he lets this go. It's spun a long way back
short of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
length ball skids away outside off, left alone
length ball on off stump, defended off the back foot
length on middle stump, defended down the pitch off the back foot
length ball on leg stump, clipped through midwicket off the back foot
short of a length on the hips. Stays tall and clips this behind square as it climbs up on him
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
short ball down leg side. Looks to pull this but can't get bat on it
length ball outside off, left alone
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
takes it away and squares him up. But Brathwaite manages to control it. Defends off the back foot
leading edge clears extra cover and runs to the wide long-off boundary. He steps out and looks to go leg side, but this seems to have held its line

bunts it straight to short leg. That's soft. No extra bounce, no bat-pad, no inside edge. It's a length ball on off, spinning into leg stump and he pushes it straight to Shaw, who barely has to move as he takes this. A strange sequence leading into that wicket. Seemed to have lost all composure
short of a length just outside off, turning away. Left alone
inside edge onto pad and wide of Pant who is diving to his left. Length ball skids on as he looks to defend for the turn
length ball tossed up wide outside off. Looks to sweep but it's into the off side off the glove
googly at a length on middle stump, draws him forward for the drive and beats him in flight. It's squeezes into the off side
short of a length on middle stump, defended into the leg side
squares him up with a googly. It's on leg and he's forced to follow it with his hands to defend on the back foot
slider from around the stumps, Powell defends off the backfoot
excellent take down leg. Stifled appeal for a fine tickle from Powell, but the umpire is unmoved. Drifting in a long way, he was right back in trying to tuck that fine.
takes him on and clears wide long-on. Steps out and swings 'come hell or high water.' Struck it beautifully in the end, but as a bowler, Ashwin won't really mind that
has Pant put that down? This was a carrom ball gone wrong. Thin bottom edge as Powell looked to cut, Pant grabbed at the ball and missed it even on the second attempt.
another carrom ball, shorter in length, worked into the leg side.
chips down the track and hoicks this across the line into the vacant deep midwicket spaces. Not to the pitch but the key was in going through with the shot, which he did.
full and straying into the pads and Hope picks that away superbly through square leg. Lovely balance and control, didn't need to keep it down as there was no fielder there. Loose delivery at 131kph
solid in defence of this length ball angling in.
defends this short of length delivery on off.
waits inside the crease and defends this incoming delivery.
banged in short but it's way over the batsman's head. Hope ducks under it
length outside off, Hope shoulders arms
dabs this into the off side, wants the single but is sent back
skids one through on off stump, defended back
swept nicely towards fine leg with the angle
slow turn, length on the shorter side as well, enough time as Hope defends off the backfoot
lunges forward and smothers this tossed up delivery
reaches out by getting to the pitch and then drives to Jadeja at extra cover
angles a full delivery in, defended from the crease.
right behind the line of this length ball on off as he defends with soft hands
length ball that holds its line around the fourth stump, left alone
defends this length delivery away from the body, but no damage done
swivels back and pulls him behind square to clear the boundary. Picked the length early and muscled it away. It helped that Umesh offers the kind of pace he does. Lovely stroke
pitched up, driven back but Umesh stops it off his own bowling and threatens to throw it back at the batsman, doesn't though.
lunges forward and blocks, rolls off the inner half of the bat to short leg.
goes right back and punches this length ball to long-on. Hit so straight back that it grazed the stumps
slider that drifts in from around the stumps, Powell defends from the crease when he should've been forward
chips down the track and eases this tossed up delivery to long-off
goes back and across to defend this shortish delivery on off
gets right to the pitch of the ball and works this with the spin to long-on
wrong'un but on the shorter side, punched to long-on
sweeps and misses. Saw the batsman attempting to play that stroke and bowled it just a touch wider.
too short and far too wide, he reaches out to punch it into the gap at sweeper cover
gets right to the pitch and defends back
touch shorter, it also stops on Powell as he shapes to cut, ends up dabbing it gently into the off side
sharp-turning legbreak on off stump, left alone.
defends this quicker delivery from the crease.
reaches out to work this flighted delivery from the stumps to short midwicket
turns this with the spin to square leg
sees the batsman stepping out and fires it in, pushed to cover
drifts in and skids through on middle, defended from the crease.
steps out and belts this flat past mid-off for a boundary. Key was in getting right to the pitch of the ball.
superb from Kuldeep. Good loop and drift away as he is beaten in trying to play inside the line.
reaches out and drives against the turn to cover
risky single as he drives to mid-off, but they finish it without much fuss in the end
turns this full delivery from the stumps to square leg
touch short, Powell waits for it to spin away as he steers to point
nice flight, lands this on middle, defended with soft hands.
driven firmly from the crease to extra cover.
right back and across as he defends with the spin to midwicket
slips this carom ball down leg, paddled away nicely past the keeper to the fine leg boundary.
sees the ball in his half, gets down on one knee and flat bats this over Ashwin's head, carries all the way.
driven with the spin, superb drive. Shami does well to pull it back in the end from mid-off. Read the carom ball off the hand and play it nicely
this one slides past the outside edge. Hope plays for the offspin but this one skids through.
eased with the spin to wide long-off
lunges forward towards the ball and smothers this
eased back with the spin towards Kuldeep
tossed up on leg stump, Hope gets right to the pitch and defends back
right back as he defends this shortish delivery to the bowler

pinned in front by a sharp turning delivery that was pitched up. Hope thought of a review and decided against it. The only good thing is he didn't waste it after complete misjudgment. He not only played back when he should've been forward but also played down the wrong line. This would've smashed middle and leg.
tossed up on leg stump, tucked to deep square leg for an easy single
tossed up and drifting in from around the stumps, he lunges forward and defends
sliced over cover. Was looking to clear mid-off but this spin away after gripping the surface. Poor from Hetmyer
rolls off a thick inside edge to short midwicket. Shaped to drive
good, clean strike over the bowler's head. Lands in front of the sightscreen. Right to the pitch before he swung this away
carom ball that spins back in but is on the shorter side outside off, left alone.
gets well forward and defends back
touch short outside off, cut away to cover
just bunts this wide of slip. Played it very late, brings up his sixth Test fifty
once again looks to cut, but this time realises there's not much width and lets it go
gets outside the line of the stumps, lunges forward and blocks
drifting into the pads, tickled towards the man coming in from fine leg
tossed up on off from around the stumps, defended.
drifting into middle again, Hetmyer has the line well covered as he deadbats
cuts but picks out point

chips this into the gap at mid-off for an easy single
slips this down leg, he looks to whip square but misses. Good grab by Pant

is he really their most promising batsman? That's a terrible, terrible shot to play. What was the need? I don't know. Did they need 20 runs in two overs? No. The situation demanded he bat, bat and bat. Instead, he looks for an ugly slog and slices it to short third man. The turn does him in as he looks to slog across the line, the dip ensures the ball takes the edge. Catches like those won't be dropped most times. This is terrible batting from West Indies and as a coach, Stuart Law, even if he is going to resign after this series, has every right to ask for accountability. Very, very poor. Kuldeep trusted himself to deceive the batsman in flight, kept at it and has now been rewarded with two wickets.
works with the spin to the leg side.
touch flatter and fuller on off, he lunges forward and blocks

there's the googly, the magic ball. Ambris has absolutely no clue as he steps out aimlessly. Pant is alert, he picked the googly, didn't grab at the ball, rode the bounce and then effected a smart stumping. It nearly touched Pant's helmet as he was surprised by the bounce, but he did well. Could this end by tea? Very much a possibility. This I'm afraid isn't Test match batting.
nice flight, lands this on off, worked down to mid-on to get off the mark
steps out and whips this against the turn to the midwicket boundary.
eases this back past the bowler to long-on
fired full on the stumps, smothered.
lunges forward and stabs this one, the ball rolls off the inside edge towards short leg
half a stride in forward as he blocks.
goes wide of the crease and releases a carom ball that lands on off, Chase picks it off the hand and carefully defends.
rocks back to cut but stops short of playing it because this one stops on him. Just defends in the end
skids one after pitching a touch ahead of length on off, defended from the crease.

leading edge to cover, as he looks to work across the line.
picks the googly, squeezes this back to the bowler.
gets outside the line of the stumps and blocks.
huge turn and fizz from the footmarks outside off, Powell jabs at this and nearly gets this inside edge onto the stumps. So, so close.
steps out and works this with the spin to mid-on.
fired full from around the stumps, defended back

drills this but Jadeja stops it on his followthrough
just eludes cover! He was looking to go mid-off but sliced it. Streaky boundary.

rocks back and cuts to deep point.
lunges forward, waits for the turn and blocks

defends from the crease, thick inside edge past KL Rahul at leg gully. Wasn't far from him. Kuldeep won't really mind. Chase played down the wrong line.
reads the googly, gets a long way forward and smothers it.

fired full on off, defended
slider on the stumps, blocked.
swung away across the line, one bounce over the long-on boundary.
steps out and works it across the line to mid-on
half-tracker, Chase rocks back to open up the leg side and pulls him to the deep square boundary

tosses it up way outside off, inducing the drive and Chase falls for the bait. Chips it straight to Ashwin at extra cover. Kuldeep has a wry smile because this was a tossed-up half-volley. Not sure he expected a wicket off that delivery, easy catch. Fourth for Kuldeep
reaches out and then drives to extra cover again.
goes right back into the crease and blocks.
wrong'un that he lands on middle, Dowrich gets well forward and blocks

wild heave but he's beaten by the dip and turn. Why oh why, I will never understand.

right to the pitch of this tossed up delivery as he defends back.

gets outside the line of the stumps and drives to mid-off

leading edge, but this rolls wide of silly point.

rocks back and cuts to Umesh at the edge of the ring at cover
driven against the turn to sweeper cover, but he got right to the pitch of the delivery
